etymologies: early 17th century: from Latin explosio(n-) ‘scornful rejection’, from the verb explodere (see explode)

definitions: a violent shattering or blowing apart of something, as is caused by a bomb

examples.text: three explosions damaged buildings at the barracks

definitions: a violent expansion in which energy is transmitted outwards as a shock wave.
a sudden outburst of something such as violent emotion, especially anger

examples.text: an explosion of anger inside the factory

definitions: a sudden political or social upheaval

examples.text: there will have to be sweeping changes if the political leaders want to avoid an explosion

definitions: a sudden increase in amount or extent

examples.text: an explosion in the adder population
